name: Windowed Forest Dungeon
description:
~~~~ Windowed Forest Dungeon ~~~~

Can you find the golden fleece lost in this dungeon forest?

This is  a short music puzzle game that uses desktop windows as dungeon rooms.

I made this game to experiment with the idea of moving a character from one window to another, and expanding the game-world using the space available in the screen.

*I haven't been able to test out how it works in Mac and Linux. Nor if the vibration works properly on controllers. So...

If you give this game a try, please share your feedback in the comments. Let me know what you think about the concept, and if it runs OK. You can also contact me by twitter or email.

------------------------------------------------------------------

Additionally, I've created a google form that can receive data from your game session. If you want to send it, there is a share button at the end of the game. The data I want to gather is:

  • The melody created while you play (new random melody each time you play).
  •  The OS you are using (checking if it works on Mac/Linux).
  • Input device (checking if it works with other controllers).
  •  Date you played and time you took playing it.
  • OS language (to check where players might come from. This is just for my own curiosity).

Again, sending this data is optional. All the data will be publicly available in this link: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1SmvdVM7QXjeMuMrbxoZoJc3ppg1TMlQcPNLQYU5R...
